Reviews.Title: “Take earplugs - if the crazies don't keep up awake, cleaning machines will....”
Reviews.Author: Keira58
Reviews.Content: We had a room with a great view - fantastic. Unfortunately - and not the fault of the Cadillac Hotel - it rained solidly for the two days we were there (who wrote "It never rains in southern California?") - it was difficult to see anything through the relentless rain. A disproportionate number of crazies enjoyed camping outside, using the seats and tables thoughtfully provided by the local authority. They ranted at great length, but otherwise kept a respectful distance: and it was a relief to have peace and quiet on one night, when the vociferous vagrants disappeared. We were woken up early the next morning, alas, by the sound of the cleaning vehicles busily eradicating all the graffiti and mess created by the hippy gangs. The Italian restaurant (Piccolo) opposite the Cadillac provides great food, but BEWARE. We had bought a $10 bottle of wine, relieved to find a BYO place, and in the candlelit gloom of the restaurant didn't spot the corkage fee accurately, believing it to be $3, which would have been fair. Our waiter had an impenetrable accent, so we thought he had said corkage would be $3. It wasn't - it was $30!!! So what seemed like a fair price for decent Italian food became exorbitant..

Reviews.Title: “loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireBones
Reviews.Content: Fab third floor corner room with three windows overlooking the ocean. Unbelieavable location right on the boardwalk, great staff including a friendly Australian lady.

Reviews.Title: “Great value on the beach- no need to be scared!”
Reviews.Author: smilbauer
Reviews.Content: I have read several bad reviews here, but I just want to remind these people of exactly where the Cadillac is located. On the boardwalk of Venice Beach! You have to expect homeless people and wackos in this area- that's part of what it's known for. If that bothers you, don't stay anywhere on Venice Beach. The hotel is clean, the rooms are perfectly sized, and the amazing ocean breeze means that you don't need an air conditioner. My friend and I loved our stay. If you're high maintenance then this hotel is not for you; and neither is Venice Beach. Both of the restaurants next to the hotel are great and Henry's Market across the street literally has everything you could need.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting place, I would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: marysmiles
Reviews.Content: My best advice about The Cadillac Hotel is to read the reviews here. Most are pretty accurate to what we found on our stay. Venice Beach itself is a place of diversity. Anything goes, and expect it. If that is not what you enjoy, find another place to visit. For us it was fun! The Cadillac Hotel is eclectic, reflecting the area perfectly. We stayed on the second floor. The room was small but clean. There is no A/C at the hotel but with the windows open it was no too bad, but a little sticky as the hotel is right next to the ocean. Just next door is a small convenience store, a restaurant/bar, and lots of shopping. All in all, for the low price of the room and if you are wanting to visit the Venice Beach area, then this is a good place to stay. There are no luxuries here, expect only the basics, but it will give you a great feel of experiencing the entire scheme of things and a very convenient ok place to sleep. We have no complaints at all about our stay except for the parking. This was the one considerable downfall, as the lot was full (it is very small) and you are basically left to find a place of your own to park. There is free parking along the street about 2 blocks up, but your car has to be moved before 8:30a.m. the following morning or it will be towed. That wasnt a big problem because you can move your car to the beach parking lot which was $6.00 for all day. It makes for a moving game though, every day. The worst part was the walk back in the evening from your car to the hotel - in the dark. There are "interesting" characters around, we didnt feel completely safe after dark. We would stay here again, but we would show up early enough to get a space to park in the hotel's lot.

Reviews.Title: “Tastefully decorated, lovely staff and very decent price”
Reviews.Author: Vanseasnow
Reviews.Content: We landed there totally by chance as we had to escape from a very lousy hostel in Hollywood (Banana Bungalow for the record... to avoid). The staff was super friendly and flexible, we ended up taking the smallest room because this was all we could afford but it was very cute and cozy with an amazing view on Venice beach and very tasteful 'art deco' decor. We had a lovely time there and will definitely go back when we get the chance! Oh and if you ever go there go to the roof to watch the sunset!

Reviews.Title: “Stuck in the 60's”
Reviews.Author: IndianapolisSprky
Reviews.Content: Were do I start. We stayed 4 nights in the suite. No parking for an Avalanche, had to pay $20 a night down 3 buildings. The room had no locks on the second floor windows. This window was right next to the fire escape and my daughters bed. I complained and they said at 3:00 PM and again at 4:00 PM they would get it fixed. We returned from our walk ( another story ) and the window was not fixed and was told probably tomorrow? I told them I would hold them fully responsible if some homeless person came up the escape and entered our rooms ( didn't matter, was fixed the next day ). Suite has absolutely no dressers, shelves nothing to unload your clothing, unless hanging up a shirt in the closet. Outside the hotel on the boardwalk, what a sight. This strip is totally stuck in the 60's. Hippies, homeless people, beggers, incense burning, peace signs everywhere, people singing playing music then coming to the resturant asking for money, freaks dressed in a little bit of anything and Oh yea, the homeless lady pointed out to me by my 13 year old daughter, peeing in the water drain outside our window at 9:00 in the morning. Don't need A.C., only 55 to 68 in June. Will not return to this area.

Reviews.Title: “I don't usually write reviews but this was so good....”
Reviews.Author: Rocky077
Reviews.Content: Even on a holiday weekend parking about which I'd been warned was tight but orderly and flexible. I used the hotel as a base and with my rental car visited four commercial locations on the West Side without difficulty. The staff took time and pains to direct me to sights I had not seen though I visit the LA area often. Rooms immaculate, service superb for a low budget hotel. Great views from the hotel roof from which I took many pictures. Numerous high quality restaurants are within walking distance. Hotel is an architectural monument but the improvements within are first class and current.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: OzSnoopy
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Hotel has a fantastic position right on Venice Beach Boardwalk. We loved the atmosphere of Venice Beach. The staff were always very helpful when we had any questions and booked our tours for us. The room was very clean and was big enough for the three of us. There are plenty of places to eat very close by and the shop across the street was very handy. Our first night when we went our walking I was a bit unsure how safe it was but we never encountered any problems. We would certainly go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Expensive and dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: burrisaz
Reviews.Content: We arrived early with some friends who recommended we arrive early to get a parking place. Little did we know that they only have parking for 17 cars and don't give parking passes for those spaces. We arrived around 11:30 a.m. well before check in or check out and were denied a parking pass although we had already parked in their parking area and there were at least 4-5 empty spaces. We waited til 1:00 to check in because they would not let us check in any sooner and at that time we still could not get a parking pass. Don't know why but we upgraded our room prior to check in and payed for probably the most expensive room in the hotel facing the beach on the 3rd floor. I would think for $225.00 per night they could slip us a parking pass. Needless to say we never got a parking pass and had to pay $40.00 to a parking lot to stay until 12:00 noon the next day otherwise we would have to move our car at 9:00 a.m. Our friends asked if they had handicapp parking and the check in desk insisted they did not have any until our friend basically told her that they are required to have handicapp and that is the only reason they were issued a parking pass. The room seemed clean, the decor was ok, but they took shortcuts everywhere when mounting the TV's and doing their finish work. The windows were filty and the homeless people woke us up VERY EARLY the next morning. Seems they can't talk in a normal tone. They were so loud you could hear them 3 blocks away. The lobby of the hotel is so plain and unlike a hotel lobby so much that if you did not know where you were going you would never think it was a hotel lobby. The elevator was very small 2 people and very clostrophobic. Oh yeah! The wireless was not free and even if you were willing to pay for it it did not work. I feel cheated!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place...”
Reviews.Author: Doc1953
Reviews.Content: The staff was absolutely great, responded to guests immediately, answered all my questions... and to top it off, it was only four block's from my adult children's home. Walked to breakfast across the alley every morning at a excellent little bistro on the beach walk, four star Italian restaurant next door, and a convenience store on the opposite corner of the building. I didn't have to start my car for four days... live music at a venue two doors North... on and on, I can't imagine a better, more beautiful location to take in the SoCal beach! I love you guys!

Reviews.Title: “A Diamond in the Rough”
Reviews.Author: kanelson
Reviews.Content: We had mixed feelings about staying at the Cadillac based on many reviews here. Having visited Venice Beach before, we were prepared for the characters that hang around the boardwalk. With that in mind, you shouldn't have any problems with them. These people can be very entertaining. At night, because we have a small child, we put him to bed and took in the sights below from the fire escape. My boyfriend often went out to grab some drinks or snacks at night and he felt safe enough. The noise does subside at around 11:00 p.m. If you book, try to get the Charlie Chaplin room. It has a great view of the boardwalk and the beach, and right beside the fire escape. It had enough room for all three of us to maneouver; it wasn't a huge room, but it was fine. We even had a cot in the room for my son. The decor was fresh and modern, and the bathroom was very spacious and beautifully done. It was great to have an IPod dock. We used it at night to mute out the outdoor noise, and it was nice to fall asleep to. The t.v. worked great, and there was tons of room in the closet. The cleaning crew kept the room impeccable each day we stayed. Only complaint about the room was that the towels were in need of being replaced as they were very rough and old. The staff at the front desk was very helpful. We asked them if they knew a good sushi restaurant and they went to the trouble of googling it and finding us a few choices with directions. The lobby was in need of being renovated in terms of the furniture choices, but I have a feeling that is coming. The floor was a work of art and very eccletic - as is much of Venice! The staff let us store our rental bikes in the storage area which was very accommodating. They also went out of their way to go to the restaurant across the street to fetch us some wine glasses. The rooftop is very nice to enjoy the views from, but could stand to be cleaned from all the cigarette butts and bird droppings. As a whole, we loved staying at this hotel. It was well worth the price for this area, and if we visited again, we would most likely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location, highly recommended!!”
Reviews.Author: intheindustry2
Reviews.Content: I first visited the Cadillac Hotel five years ago and was impressed by its location and accessibility to LAX, Santa Monica the Venice Beach Boardwalk and numerous activities available in the area. This time I returned with my 14 year young son for spring break in LA. We travelled from Vancouver, Canada. First off I am very aware that Venice Beach reflects a diverse and eclectic mix of society and in part that alone can contribute to one's experience. We felt safe and never encountered any threatening behavior from a small group of street people scattered amongst the crowd of faces from all parts of the world taking in the uniqueness of this somewhat artsy/edgy community. During our three night stay we took in a basketball game at the Staples Center, cycled the Boardwalk to Manhattan Beach and walked during the evenings to Santa Monica, and back to the hotel, it is fair to say the noise factor if any subsides by 11:30 p.m. Jeff & Shirey ( the Hotel Management ) are friendly, extremely helpful and caring. The Housekeepers/Maids do a very good job of maintaining very clean bathrooms, thoroughly vacuum the carpets, the beds are comfortable with clean, pressed white linens. In my opinion this hotel represents very good value for the price paid, it was a fun, memorable trip - we will return. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “The Cadillac - Up On Blocks”
Reviews.Author: greypawn
Reviews.Content: Worst hotel I have ever stayed at in my entire life. Firstly, you can practically "feel" the crime rate in the area. The alleys this glorified motel sits in is littered with drunks, prostitutes and rude homeless. There is little outside apart from the glowing pink neon to indicate this is actually a hotel. The inside lobby is disgusting garage sale art deco, featuring a claustrophobic elevator, one-man sized, that made me fear for my life. I opened the door to my room, with high hopes of a respite from a day's travel from the East Coast, only to have them obliterated as the sickly halogen light illuminated the room. I have never seen a room in any hotel, short of Tokyo Coffin Motels, as small as this dismal room was. The queen size bed, which looked like something Ikea would throw out as "cheap particle board", occupied nearly the entirety of the room. In order to reach the far end of the room, one physically would have to contort to dodge the poorly mounted HDTV on the wall and the foot of the bed. Space between the wall and the bed was literally about 5 inches. the far side of the spartan room featured a spindley table and two rickety chairs that appeared to have been saved from the trash heap of a dwelling in the ghetto. They did not appear to be capable of bearing weight in the slightest. A small fridge hummed in the corner, and was the only place I could actually put my luggage up on. The heat and claustrophic effect of the room made me look instinctively for the thermostat. There was none. The room was not climate controlled. It had an ominous looking ceiling fan that I cranked to high while I flipped on the TV - an HDTV flat screen, ironically hooked up to cable quality rivalling that of tin-foil-covered rabbit ears antenna reception. The bathroom made me long for the comparatively wide open spaces of a lavatory on a Southwest Airlines Boeing 737. The shower was fine, so long as you stood perfectly still with your hands at your sides. See, not enough room to raise your arms in the shower. It was about 2 feet by 2 feet. The towels, of which there were three... had the texture of high grade sandpaper. Cotton thread count 30. I took my shoes off, and the carpet was actually sticky to the touch. Underneath the bedsheets was a layer of plastic. Having read other reviews of this hotel, I realize now that the plastic was not to prevent a guest from ruining the bed, but rather to mitigate the high chance of a guest catching scabies or bedbugs from the beds. After spending a single night in The Cadillac, we cancelled our five day stay and forfeited the following night's charge.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, renovated, perfect spot on Venice Beach”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 4 nights in May 2008 after escaping a too expensive and snobby Beverly Hills "In-Hotel" . Although the renovation was still going on, we were able to stay in a beautiful newly renovated room on the top floor with a spectacular ocean view. Also you were able to step up to the roof where we had great views to Santa Monica and LA. We also loved the surroundings which was by our feeling not at all dangerous, but very colorful and interesting. It is close to bars, good restaurants and caffees. Maybe it is not the right hotel for familys, but if you want to have a good time and dive into the spirit of Venice Beache, go for it. We (my girlfriend and me) loved it and will definetly return.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare! Never Again! Beware!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: BrazilanCouple
Reviews.Content: I am from Brazil, so forgive all spelling mistakes.... Me and my wife went to California to visit San Francisco, Los Angeles, Las Vegas and other small towns. After staying in a lot of motels, we searched for a nice place. Our Guide Book didnÂ´t give us much options but recomended Cadillac because of its location. Whe got to Cadillac very late, after a long car trip. So, we just wanted to stay somewhere safe with a nice bed. When we got to the Cadillac, we though our GPS was wrong because all we could see were a lot of homeless in front of one building. We got really scared (first time we did not felt safe in USA) but since wwe didnt know about other places to stay and it was very late, we decided to give it a shot. Since it was saturday, they only had the simplest room avaiable (cant blame them for that). Even though, we had to pay 129,00 + tax per night. Well, scarred and without opitions, we decided to stay for one night and then look for another place. When we did our check in, we made very clear that we where propably staying only for one night. Right after we finished our check in, and before we go to the room, we asked if it was safe to leave some things in the car. Since the parking lot is payed, and expensive, i assumed they would be respossable for safety. The lady from the hotel told me that i had to take everything out of the car, because it was not safe and they dont assume responsability for anything that happens to the car and its contents. Worried, I asked her 1 minute and went to a public phone, in front of the hotel, and called for another hotel placed in Santa Monica. The Hotel in Santa Monica was classified as very good but expensive, the reason why i did not look for it before. I decided to expend more, but to feel safe, and decided to call just to see if they had vacancy. I found out that the hotel had rooms for 99 + tax per night. Very happy to have an alternative, i went back to the Cadillac Hotel and asked to cancel my check in, since i did not entered the room yet. Then I was told that if i cancelled it i would have to pay for that night and for the parking!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Very pissed off I decided to stay for that night. The room was very small but looked clean. So we started taking out of the car all luggage we had, felling unsafe, because the parking is on the back off the building, where there is almost no light and some homeless. After taking a shower in that ridiculous small shower box, we layed to sleep (about 1 am). After some minutes my wife started to scream, saying that shell felt something in her leg. We found a medium cocorach walking over the sheets. I call the front desk and asked to change room or to change sheets. The front desk lady said we couldnt change room because we had already "used" the on we were in and she also said that she had no other sheets avaiable for queen bad. I asked for changing sheets with any room and she said it was not alouded, because someone else could check in that night. Really pissed off, but tired as hell, we made a huge search in the room for another bugs, and we did found another cocoroach (smaller) under the bed. I called again front desk and complained again. I was told that cocoroachs have wings and they can come in anytime by the windows, so the hotel have is not responsible for that. What a joke! Ok.... on the next morning i asked to check out really soon (7:30 am). I was told that my check in was for 3 nights and, if i checked out early, i would have to pay U$ 75 fee. Actually, that was writen on the check in paper that I had signed, but I told the lady, on the check in, that i was checking for only one night, that i would propably change hotel, and she said that i would be charged, if i decided to do so. Felling robbed, i decided not to fight anymore against the hotel, and said i would stay one more night only, since i was not going to lose U$ 75 for nothing. Tha same day I got back to the hotel and informed, again, that i wass leaving on the next day. That night we did not found bugs on the room, but the noise from the homeless in front of the hotel made very difficult to sleep nice. On the next morning, again, I asked for check out and again I was told that there would be a U$ 75 fee, since I have to ask for early check out 48hs in advanced. The thing is.... since it was my second day on that hotel, is was impossible to ask for early check out. because I needed to know it even before I check in.... it is crazy. Incredulous that I was having this kind of treatment in the US, I asked to talk to the manager, but It was denied because the manager was at home with his family and the hotel was not autorized to call at his home for "minor" issues. I was told to call on the next day. I said I was staying one more day and had to talk with manager to check out withpout paying that fee. The front desk men just said: I am sorry, but there is nothing I can do for you. Conclusion. For the first time in my hole life I felt robbed, cheatted. In the last 6 years I have gone to a lot of coutrys, like Bolivia, Colombia, Peru, Uruguay... and a lot of big cities, like Nova York, Londres, Paris, and I never felt so unsafe and so robbed like this time. So here is my review: - I was cheated by the front desk over and over - The Hotel is very expensive - Rooms are quite small and, though they look clean, we found cocoroachs on it (one in the bed). Staff did not autorized us to change room, neither changed the sheets. - The bath box is ridicously small - The hotel charges a lot for parking but gives no security - The manage isnÂ´t there... he likes to stay with his family why guests have cocoroach problems. After so many problems he should at least have called us. - The only thing that should be good is itÂ´s localization, since it is near the beach. Though, it is not good. There are homeless (a lot) walking around the hotel all the time, so it becomes really unsafe to get out of the hotel after it is dark. - I just felt happy when i check out, even being robbed and having to pay an absurd fee. My sugestion: DONT GO. Stay anywhere else even if you have to pay more for that. I have already contacted my Guide Book publisher and made a formal complain

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time at the Caddy!”
Reviews.Author: rweekend
Reviews.Content: We just spent a weekend on Venice beach at the Cadillac Hotel! We had a great stay, the hotel is newly renovated and the staff was very good! The rooms are tastefully decorated and minimalistic in a good way. It is right on the Venice beach boardwalk and nothing is more than a 10minute walk away. The only thing that is missing is a bar/lounge in the lobby but we found out from the manager that it is in the works. There is a nice little cafe and a very nice Italian restaurant right outside the from door thought. If you are renting a car be sure to get a very compact car as parking in the hotel lot and Santa Monica in general can be very tight.

Reviews.Title: “Nowhere near as ad as lots of the reviews”
Reviews.Author: mambo202
Reviews.Content: Me & my friend stayed at the Cadillac at the end of July this year for 4 nights. We were both really scared at first after reading the reviews and even considered changing our accommodation. We thought we would give it a try anyway and glad we did. The view and beach location was really good. It is true it may be a little scary but i felt safe in the day and may have been more scary at night but there was 2 of us and staying together walking at night together -didn't have a problem. Theres definatley some weirdos but none bothered us just keep walking and ignore and your fine. Its kind of located in between santa monica and venice too so we spent lots of time in Santa Monica where the food and shops are much nicer. My friend felt safe enough walking around by her self at night. If you dont ask for trouble you wont get it. The hotel staff were also really nice, the rooms were clean. Quite hot but there were fans so thats fine. Have cool fridges and a stereo u can play your ipod music from. They were helpful booking tours too and airport transfers.

Reviews.Title: “Dont worry!”
Reviews.Author: YorksireLassUk
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed in August for 3 nigths. Although we didn't pay for an ocean view ,the view out of our window was FANTASTIC! We had read all he reviews and were a little apprehensive. BUT there was nothing to worry about and we felt quiet safe , even when coming back after eating out in Santa Monica late at night. Yes ,there are some "different " people hanging around ,but this is Venice beach! We had a great time and the rooms were lovely (especial the shower!) Please don't let the bad reviews put you off .We would totally recomend the Cadiilac to anyone wanting to stay at the "beach" in L.A.

Reviews.Title: “incubo”
Reviews.Author: ItalyBiba
Reviews.Content: the location is beautiful but also very dangerous. This hotel is surrounded by homeless people, drunks, crazy people, and derelicts. This can be a very dangerous place for families with children.It was impossible to sleep there isn't air conditioned and the noise is terrible....................

Reviews.Title: “Such a Relief!”
Reviews.Author: thanktheuniverse
Reviews.Content: My family had to book a lot of rooms for a wedding, by the time I ran across The Cadillac Hotel, I had already spent a good deal of time looking for a place to accommodate our large group as well as our need to find the right price. They literally saved the day when it was beginning to become hopeless by not only accommodating my needs but by also making it so simple to book all of the rooms. Its right on the board walk/beach, and there are plenty restaurants, small convenience stores and so forth all in walking distance. If you have been to Venice beach you will understand that having all of that near by is great! The staff was always very friendly and helpful. I believe we came in towards the end of most of the renovations so everything was clean and nice, good sized rooms, simple but effective things such as blow dryer, iron/ironing board, in room safe, small electric cooler for your drinks. Access to the roof top for beautiful sun sets and a nice cup of coffee in the morning. There is no A/C but you don't really need it if you keep your windows up and the fan on while you enjoy the beautiful sea breezes (of course I am in Phx. AZ so we were really enjoying the weather.) The bathrooms were great, one issue I typically run into is bathing my 4 year old and I have experienced hotel showers that made that difficult however the bathroom and showers in the Cadillac were great. There is a big gathering space down stairs next to the lobby with Internet access, a pool table and TV, I thought that was neat, and the Internet access came in handy! We stayed a week and though we were all beginning to miss our own beds, our stay at the Cadillac was still very pleasant and met all of our needs, and for that we are grateful and happy to say that The Cadillac Hotel really took a lot off our shoulders especially in planning a week long trip for a very large party of people from ages 4 to 60. My personal opinion that is is a place for everyone, for any occasion, of all walks of life. The board walk is a very busy and loud place, but its one of the reasons we enjoy our time there so much. We make it down there once or twice a year and plan on booking with the Cadillac again!

Reviews.Title: “Not for your consideration .....”
Reviews.Author: streaker3
Reviews.Content: Don't stay at the Cadillac Hotel in Venice Beach. Although the location is beautiful but also very dangerous. This hotel is surrounded by homeless people, drunks, crazy people, and derelicts. This can be a very dangerous place for families with children of all ages! The tenants are mostly drug addicts and stay for the weekend. The police are called all the time and there is no proper lightning for the property. Several unsolved murders have occurred several steps from the hotel. They have remodeled this art deco building and it looks beautiful but the danger that lurks at night has remained the same....stay away!

Reviews.Title: “Can see the potential”
Reviews.Author: Safaridog23
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, and another couple stayed here for 2 nights in May. We knew that they were renovating and were not expecting a luxury accomodation. We got exactly what we were expecting at an amazing price! I think this building has great potential and would love to see how it turns out. It is still rough right now, the rooms are all done, but the rest of the hotel is under construction. Having said that, there was never any noise, so it never bothered us. The staff here is amazing, I have never encountered such helpful staff! I think they really love what they do. The location can't be beat, you're right on the beach. It's only about a 15-20 minute walk along the beach to the Santa Monica pier. The rooms look exactly like the pictures posted on here, however ours was quite small. It was fine for the two of us for a few nights, but I think I'd want something bigger for a longer stay. The biggest con of this hotel is no air conditioning in the rooms! It wasn't too bad while we were there, but I imagine it would be pretty hot in the summer. There is a ceiling fan, but that's it. The windows do open, but there are no screens, and it is noisy outside at night, probably too much so to leave them open. The other con is the lighting, especially in the bathroom. It wasn't very bright and hard to do my makeup in the mornings, silly, but I think noteworthy. So overall, if you're looking for a cheap, clean place in a great location, this is a great find.

Reviews.Title: “Good price/quality ratio”
Reviews.Author: TravelR69
Reviews.Content: After reading all the raving reviews I really expected a little more from the hotel. Granted, the renovation works are still ongoing, but that shouldn't mean their service should suffer. My girlfriend and I stayed there for the weekend at the suite (3rd floor), and the ocean views were marvelous and the space more than enough. The guys there were also very helpful in arranging for a good rate, which ended up being about $200 incl tax per night. The negatives: elevator didn't work for "maintenance reasons" and the stairs were covered with plank etc; we didn't find any towels / privacy sign in the room; the ceiling in the bathroom was damanged from a previous flood; also no mini-bar. The room, although has a new bed and newly painted walls, suffers from the "old room" feel - part of it is really old windows and shabby carpet. But otherwise it is a nice place and really good price/quality ratio. Next time though I would probably pay more and stay at a more decent hotel in Santa Monica, as Cadillac did not exactly feel safe at night either.

Reviews.Title: “Quite a find”
Reviews.Author: VaNative
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4-day stay at The Cadillac Hotel. I would stay there again depending on the reason for the trip. My son and I were doing a college tour along with another mom and son and thought that staying on Venice Beach would be fun for the teenage boys. Our days were busy so it was actually the moms who enjoyed the beachfront and the boys slept in. The Cadillac is undergoing renovation, but it didn't affect us at all except that we enjoyed an attractively low rate. The rooms were simply appointed with beds, flat screen tv, and small fridge. New paint job, carpets, and bathroom greeted us from a long trip on the red-eye. Everything was very clean. There was no chest of drawers, but the closet has built-in shelves. There was no chair or table in one of the rooms, but I think there was a chair in the other. Try to get a room with the flat screen tv between the beds, not at the end of the room. The boys said the tv at the far end of the room wasn't as bad as they thought. They also had a sink outside the bathroom which they didn't quite understand, but which I think could be handy when sharing a room. Our favorite part was the location -- right on the beach. We enjoyed walking every morning along the walkways and down on the beach. There are some nice eateries and coffee places open early. The Fig Tree has wonderful, healthy breakfasts at half price before 9 a.m. I bought some breakfasts at Henry's market right across from the Cadillac, and they were delicious. We dared not venture on the beach after dark. There is a large 'bohemian' contingent situated at the gathering place in front of the Cadillac,. This did not deter us from staying there and we felt safe walking in a group back from the parking lot. There is a lovely Italian restaurant across from the Cadillac where we caught a nice glass of wine (although pricey) at the end of a day and we felt quite safe. The staff was very nice and helpful with any questions we had. We would all stay there again if we weren't going to spend much time in a hotel. It was perfect for us. I only wish we had more time to take in the sights of Venice Beach during the day, but we were busy visiting colleges and relatives. I often travel for leisure and stay at resorts with family. You won't be disappointed with the Cadillac as long as you know that it is streamlined and clean. The great location and great price make the Cadillac quite a find!

Reviews.Title: “Like in Baywatch!”
Reviews.Author: gerniedark
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel 2days, while I was in Los Angeles. We made the booking trought www.hostels.com, we were suppose to go to the Cohotel wich is a hotel nearby the Cadillac, I think the same owner as well, but as they had no availabality they sent us to the Cadillac! This hotel is amazing, really clean, decoration is nice (flat tv screen and radio to plug ur ipod) and the best thing is the LOCATION LOCATION, just in Venice Beach beachwalk... nearby all the shops cafes and restaurants.. Santa Monica pier is just 10min away from the hotel walking by the beachwalk. I think this hotel really worth it! The staff were so friendly explaining all the main attractions in LA, ( so we booked a tour to sightseeing the city in the hotel). And the very last day we booked a shuttle to get to the airport. The shuttle was almost one hour late, so we were nearly to miss our flight back to London.. so the guy in the reception was so nice that booked a cab to the aiport for us and paid for it too.. We paid 150$ for 2nights wich is a amazing price, but I donÂ´t know if those are the Cohotel fares or the cadillac fares actually. Dont forget to have ur breakfast in the Figtree before 9am, its a restaurant just around the corner and they do amazing breakfast!! (healthy ones) half price before 9am. Well enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret in town”
Reviews.Author: mbloisbrooke
Reviews.Content: This has to be the best value anywhere and for Venice its outstanding. We picked it out of the DK Eyewitness California travel guide. The Cadillac is right on the beachfront with its own offroad parking. Shirley on the front desk and the rest of the staff are great. They are renovating all three floors to a tasteful European standard, simple but very comfortable, pastel colours and flat screen TV. When we were there 2 out of the 3 floors were completed. Stay here but dont tell anyone! At around $100 it is terrific value although I appreciate that this is probably a winter/renovation price. Dont expect it to stay this price for too long.

Reviews.Title: “2nd time is a charm”
Reviews.Author: Hoosierhillbilly
Reviews.Content: I stayed here the first time about a year and a half ago and swore I'd never return, I'm glad I broke my promise. The first time the place was more of a European style hostel with dorm rooms and "private" rooms and very little cleanliness. I've been going to Venice for most of my life and always end up staying in land, not many choices at the beach. I heard the property was under new managment and under going renovations, so I decided to try them again. The place is like a whole new property. Although the lobby still needs some work, I stayed on the 3rd floor facing the North side, could see the beach from the window. All new furniture, carpets, beds, amazing place. I love expereincing the bohemian vibe of Venice but don't want it in my hotel. No worries here, I felt like I was at a beach resort in Miami. I'm sure the rates will continue to go up some, but they could double them and it would still be worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Good Times....”
Reviews.Author: UpTownGirlLondon
Reviews.Content: Great location and friendly staff. The hotel was in the middle of being rennovated, surpisingly that did not affect our stay. The rennovated rooms were of a high standard, with plasma tellies, fridges and hair dryers. The staff had great knowledge of the attractions etc in the area and were on hand to help 24 7. It is situated just off venice beach which is lovely first thing in the morning, when you can enjoy your breakfast overlooking the beach/sea. It is nice and peaceful on the beach during the day. It is not far from Santa Monica where you can enjoy shopping and it restaurants. The sunsets from Santa Monica Pier are breathtaking. It is an ideal base if you want to sample a bit of LA.

Reviews.Title: “The Cadillac was divine”
Reviews.Author: Kassa28
Reviews.Content: Fab location, right on venice beach. Many restuarants within walking distance. Staff are very helpful. Parking available as well. The rooms have just been renovated, so they are lovely: new plasma tvs, high spec. bathrooms. If you are not looking to back pack but go to LA in style at a fab location, this is the place. It is reasonably priced too.

Reviews.Title: “What are they thinking?”
Reviews.Author: MargieSeattle
Reviews.Content: Because they are in the middle of a renovation, the rates for the Cadillac are quite reasonable considering the location. We stayed on the newly renovated 4th floor. Our room was small, but nicely appointed..but then we looked closely. Our room long, skinny room had 2 queen beds, an ocean view, a large, wall mounted, flat screen TV, and a really cool refrigerator in it's own, free standing, custom case. Too bad for us-the TV was at the end of the room, facing a blank wall. It didn't swivel, and there was no where to sit to look at it. The approx. 2'x2' refrigerator cabinet was the only piece of furniture in the room, so there was no place to set anything except the floor. The bathroom had a toilet and shower-the sink was in the bedroom. There was a shelf over the sink, but no towel holder-where to put a towel but on the shelf. And no waste basket-that was in the bathroom. The towels are hard and scratchy. I crawled into bed on our first night, and was shocked to feel plastic under my feet at the end of the bed. Turns out, the bottom sheet was a flat sheet, tucked in at the top, but not long enough to tuck in at the bottom. I complained about it, and the next night, my bed was fine, but my daughters bed was short sheeted. There was NO information in the room, no written material about the hotel or the area, the telephone had no information regarding phone numbers or charges. I didn't have cell phone reception in the hotel, so I used the hotel phone for local calls, assuming there was no charge for local calls. I was wrong. They charge 75 cents for each call. The walls are so thin, you can practically hear people breathing in the next room. The elevator was working only intermittently when we arrived, and the smell of paint was overwhelming. The hotel is right on the Venice boardwalk. A great location during the day-but I didn't want to be outside after dark. On the plus side, the staff was very nice, and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “So terrible it was funny!”
Reviews.Author: bwklei
Reviews.Content: This place is a DUMP! We stayed this summer for one night and checked out early! We actually thought the room was a joke when we walked in... The smell from the room just about knocked us over, there was no telephone, the TV didn't work and the bed were disgusting. We decided to 'tough' it out so we could explore Venice Beach and Santa Monica Peir. The final straw was when we discovered the next morning that the shower didn't work! Save your money! The only good thing about the stay is the stories we have to tell about it!

Reviews.Title: “The new 4th floor is superb, check out my pics!!”
Reviews.Author: YankeeTraveller_7
Reviews.Content: When I first arrived at the Cadillac i was greeted by a fairly tired looking lobby but extremely helpful staff. I was suspicious to say the least. I was told the property was undergoing renovation and was advised to stay on the 'new' 4th floor. I reluctantly agreed to take a look. IT WAS SUPERB! Do not be deceived by the 'old' hotel like I was the lobby was being used as temporary storage. This property is going to be marvelous when it's finished. CHECK OUT THE PICTURES I TOOK. They speak louder than any words i could write in this review. A thank you to all the wonderful staff that made my stay so comfortable. Right from the maids to the management. They are all at the top of their game. See you all again on my next trip to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Go for somewhere in Santa Monica instead”
Reviews.Author: Reviewer5
Reviews.Content: This is the kind of hotel where guests are just an annoying inconvenience. The evening reception guy just threw some forms in our direction to be completed. When we took a moment to discuss which of us would pay the $10 a day parking fee. he told us to hurry up. The refurbished rooms on the 4th floor are nicely done but unfortunately you have to venture through the rest of the hotel to get there. The 'guest lounge' and 'pool table area' at the entrance look nothing like the website, they're filled with old mattresses and bedroom furniture and are completely unusable. Venice Beach itself is nice during the day but doesn't have many places to eat in the evening and to be honest it's pretty scary venturing out after dark (there was a punch-up outside our bedroom window on the second night). Do yourself a favour, stay on Santa Monica.

Reviews.Title: “The Best!”
Reviews.Author: Livindreams
Reviews.Content: Landed in The Cadillac hotel at around midnight by accident as the hotel I had booked didn't have my booking. The Staff here were amazing!!! The were always friendly and assisted us with all of our inquiries. Nothing was too much trouble! The rooms were beautiful and less expensive. originally the holiday home of Charlie Chaplin. The Forth floor has been renovated and have flat screen tv's, ocean views and gorgeous paint and carpet. The best location on Venice Beach. Highly Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “You'll be SO disappointed; stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: TARColumbus_OH
Reviews.Content: This place is really, really nasty. It was so run down and depressing. The mattresses were old and saggy...I can't think of one redeeming quality except it is on the beach. We stayed on the third floor and spent $169, including parking. The walls are paper thin, the furnishings--gross. Lots of street noise. In general: disgusting. My opinion, Venice is a place to ride your bike through, but not to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Saved our holiday”
Reviews.Author: Laponia
Reviews.Content: After a two month long road trip and almost no money left, Cadillac Hotel saved our holiday when Venice Beach Hostel let us down! We had booked the stay in LA early since we knew that the area around Santa Monica and Venice Beach is rather expensive. You can imagine the feeling when we arrived and was told that they had given our room to someone else! I had the order confirmation but they could not care less and showed us the door. It did not help much that we got the $22 deposit back, since I knew that now it would be impossible to find a decent and affordable place to stay. I was wrong! We found Cadillac Hotel in a hotel guide, cheap compared to many other alternatives but still not fully booked. In the beginning, this left me a little suspicious, but there were only good surprises! The hotel is right on the beach walk and our room had ocean view. Also, we got a queen size bed even though we could only afford to pay for the single beds, greatly appreciated being newly engaged. The room was nice and clean and there was Internet access for a small fee. There was even parking behind the hotel for a decent fee. There was also great overall service, e.g. we were missing one towel and it was sent up while I was still in the shower in a matter of minutes. Finally, the hotel went the extra mile to solve a misunderstanding when they did not have to. Before leaving we made an agreement that the hotel would ship a package back to Sweden that had not arrived yet. I signed a paper authorizing them to charge my credit card for the shipping costs. However, there was a misunderstanding regarding the shipping and it resulted in the shipping being much more expensive than we thought. The hotel had my approval to send it, and I was back in Sweden, so they could have ignored me. Instead they were kind and friendly and agreed to split the shipping cost. Great service! I will definitely stay there again if I go back!

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: sarahdot
Reviews.Content: didnt experience any of the problems listed on here. yeah it was really basic and kind of hippy ish but the location was fab (20 seconds from the beach, 5 mins from shops/restaurants) the rooms had everything you needed and we had come from an AWFUL hotel downtown so it was a happy escape. the parking was limited but to be fair, its on the beach so what can you expect? loved it, wouldnt hesitate to go back again

Reviews.Title: “You can't go wrong, HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!”
Reviews.Author: TheChicagoBear
Reviews.Content: Having only reviewed Trip Advisor after I had booked I was extremely worried about my stay at The Cadillac but upon my arrival I was upgraded to the newly renovated 4th floor and was completely blown away. It felt like i was staying in a $500 a night boutique hotel in Manhattan NY! They've really put the effort in and no expense seems to have been spared. Not only is it bright, airy and chic, it has that homely feel that is very difficult to find at a hotel. I'm a frequent city business traveler and would normally stay in downtown when visiting LA. Seeing as it was the summer I thought I'd stay by the beach to soak up some atmosphere during my free time. Having searched long and hard it was near on impossible to find a budget hotel right on the seafront hence the reason why I ended up at The Cadillac. The prices being quoted for the renovated rooms are more than reasonable and you simply won't find anywhere in the area that has the beach right on your doorstep. You can literally hear the lapping waves as you drift off to sleep. I've done my research and it really is unmatchable. I would highly recommend seeing it for yourself. Don't believe everything you read on here, this place is rapidly on the turn for the better. I personally cannot wait for the hotel to be completed and will definitely be back in the near future. Many thanks to all the staff for a very pleasant stay. See you again soon.

Reviews.Title: “The results of the renovation are superb.....”
Reviews.Author: Dominic21
Reviews.Content: I've been coming to The Cadillac for 12 years and it's certainly been in need of renovation for some time. During my recent summer visit the new management gave me a tour of the completed 4th floor and it looks truly unbelievable. What a turnaround and better still the rates are highly competitive, if not unmatchable, for a beach side Hotel. They have fully revamped the place with modern elegant furniture, the bathrooms are incredibly well turned out with beautiful tiling and fixtures, all rooms have new HD plasma screens which is a must these days, they also have ipod clock radios so you can play your own music, the list goes on..... I now can't wait for a return visit. The hotel is steeped in history and the building itself carries an incredible amount of charm. If the new 4th floor is anything to go by this hotel will be restored back to it's splendid best in next to no time. Many thanks to all the staff. Keep up the magnificent renovation work and i'll certainly be back sooner rather than later! All the best.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money - your mileage may vary.”
Reviews.Author: Sylvene
Reviews.Content: Built in 1905 and once the summer residence of Charlie Chaplin, do not expect this hotel to be one of those chi-chi climate controlled $500 a night Santa Monica hotels. The windows open - but without screens, there will be bugs. The doors at the ends of the corridors open to the fire escape and will be opened during the day for the lovely sea breezes - There will be bugs! The showers are so small you whack your elbow turning around. The beds are hard and the pillows flat, but they change the sheets and towels everyday. It's ON the beach, the price is right, the atmosphere is great, the maids friendly, the front desk a little disorganized. I met customers who come back year after year for their holiday on the Beach. If you're the type that backpacks, that laughs and enjoys the experience of living with villagers in some far-flung spot in the world, scooping water out of a bucket for a bath... you'll love the Cadillac. Those expecting fluffy fat towels, a chocolate on your fluffy pillow and little bottles of useless shampoo/conditioner/body lotion, this isn't the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: J.Y-UK
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel and was quite pleasently surprised after reading all the reviews on here. For a $100 a night, I thought it was great value at that and will def stay again when I return next month. Yes it clearly is in the throes of renovations but it is clean with all the ammenities you would need plus it is right on the beach. For it's location alone, I think it was money well spent and I was especially impressed with the staff who were always very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Hot Spot for Credit Card Fraud”
Reviews.Author: droyea
Reviews.Content: NEVER STAY AT THIS HOTEL!!!! The Cadillac Hotel offers a poverty level product, terrible service, unethical business practices and an overall awful experience. Not only is it under construction and in terrible shape they committed fraud against my credit card of which I am now fighting to get my money back. The interior is awful with old mis-matched furniture and worn out carpets and bedding. The electrical outlets in the rooms don't work and the bathroom is a science project for mould. When I checked in they extended my reservation without permission to conveninetly charge me a "early departure fee" when I tried to check out the next day. In summary if you want to be over charged and taken advantage of while staying in a pathetic accomodation this is your place. If you prefer even a small bit of class or respect I highly recommend you keep searching for other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: Sydney-7
Reviews.Content: On a trip around the US, my sister and i stayed at Cadillac while in Venice beach. Hostels.com stuffed our booking but the hotel where happy enough to give us a room..with a discount!!! location is perfect and staff are the best i have ever come across. The cafe across the road is lots of fun. Its been a while since we stayed there but i will be staying there again for sure. Obviously, if you are after a five star boutique hotel, dont bother, but as far as youth hostels goes, this was honestly the best!!!! ps. no bedbugs...thats a load of B.S elle and annie, sydney australia

Reviews.Title: “Oh dear...”
Reviews.Author: grazinggoat66
Reviews.Content: Oh dear...............that is about as kind as I can be about the Cadillac Hotel in Venice Beach. I should qualify my comments by stating that this is a hotel that is ONLY suited to those who don't mind anything other than the most basic of creature comforts. The location is also as close as you can get to the beach, but for those who haven't been to Venice Beach, then go 3 or 4 mile up the coast and stay at Santa Monica.....you will not regret paying the extra for the security and quality of accomodations. The rooms at the Cadillac comprised of 2 single beds of which one collapsed as soon as I sat on it....courtesy of the wheel on the bed which had previously snapped and just been propped up. The bathroom is VERY BASIC. A 50 year old pedestal vanity handbasin, a toilet that was an "adventure", and a shower which was "interesting". Security is absolutely non-existent (hallways open to the fire escapes and the elements and windows are unable to be locked) and coupled with the front desk double booking our room (a key opening our room at 11pm whilst we were fast asleep and a startled middle aged couple standing before us) made this easily the worst hotel experience I have had. Needless to say, I won't be recommending this "hostel" to any one else.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Worst Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mc11
Reviews.Content: I've traveled the US and Europe and stayed in many hotels and this place ranks as the second worst hotel I have ever stayed in. Don't believe any review that places it above terrible. While it is true that the three staff members I met were friendly they had no idea how to run a hotel. The first room I checked into had not been cleaned after the former tenant so I was moved to a corner room (not ocean view). The room was furnished in 1980's garage sale art deco style (looks better in the site photos than it really is). The curtains fell off the rods when I tried to close them. I had no towels. The sheets were clean but did not fit the beds. The beds were old and the mattress was poor. The neighborhood seemed fairly safe but there were a lot of stoned homeless wandering around late at night. The only good thing about the hotel is the view from the roof. I'm surprised this place has not been gutted and turned into condos! While the price is cheap itâ€™s not worth the stay! And the number one worst place I have stayed? A roach infested bunk house hostel in the woods with outdoor showers and no window screens located 20 mile outside of Savannah, Ga. The Cadillac Hotel is better than that place.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay here.....”
Reviews.Author: Pensta81
Reviews.Content: This hotel (if you could call that), was absolutely disgusting. I spent 6 weeks travelling throughout America and stayed in MANY hotels but this one was by far the worst. When we walked into the hotel my heart automatically sank. It looked like a dump and I was going to be stuck here for 5 nights. The paint effect hurt my eyes. Once we had been given our key (an old fashioned real key instead of the new card type ones in REAL hotels), we went to the lift to go to our floor only to be told it is sort of broken. Meaning we had to physically open the doors using all our strength and hold them open while getting in. It was very scary to say the least. The room was nothing flash. There were two single beds, and the bedding didn't even match. The beds were highly uncomfortable and I believe they came out on Noah's Arc. The TV, which didn't have a remote, only had one working channel and 8 Spanish ones that were fuzzy. The bathroom was tiny and very ill equipped. We didn't even have any towels. We were told at the desk that they should be there and then given to us for us to take them up. I walked off showing that they could bring them up to me. What else am I paying for? The TV didn't work, the beds were bad, the room smelt, the service wasn't good, no towels, and the area was VERY scary. I felt trapped in a tuna can at nights as Venice Beach has quite a lot of undesirable people walking around. The Candle Cafe which is right across from the hotel was the only place I was willing to walk to from our hotel so I don't run into any scary homeless people. I hated my time at Venice Beach and I hated this hotel. I will never stay here again nor will I visit LA again. My travel agent will be hearing about this as it was her that told me about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Cadillac Hotel hygine issues”
Reviews.Author: fourfifteen
Reviews.Content: My friend and I contracted bed bugs/scabies from this hotel. We could see the bugs on our bunk bed clearly the entire time we were there. I've spent a fortune on treatment and doctors visits, not to mention that I'm scarred from head to toe. I would not reccomend this hotel to ANYONE.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay here again”
Reviews.Author: ASLFDTK
Reviews.Content: I had read all the feedback on this site and others and was quite aprehensive about staying here. I must say that I was pleasantly surprised when I finally got there. Yes the place is run down and very basic but the sheets were clean, the shower hot and the location superb! The rooms do smell a bit but I think that's some strange cleaning fluid they spray on the floor - just wear something on your feet at all times. As for the noise, Venice Beach is noisy no matter where you stay, that's part of it's charm! I wouldn't bother with an ocean view room, get one that's down the side as it's a bit quieter. I also highly recommend the candle cafe across the alley - great beer and you get to watch the always entertaining the passing parade. I never felt unsafe in Venice beach even at night, there are police everywhere and the minte someone even looks like they might do something odd they're jumped on by 6 buff officers and taken away in handcuffs. It's not the Ritz but I loved it!

Reviews.Title: “the cadillac is a 5 star plus hotel in hitchhikers guide”
Reviews.Author: vkrieger
Reviews.Content: this is also to compensate the many negative critics. i myself have stayed in countless places in the world (even hotels - only havent made it yet to the ISS so far...). the cadillac is definitely a place i always recommend a friend to stay. others may want stay at other places... the rooms can be locked. the showers have really hot water at any time you come back from the beach. the rooms and beds are cleaned every day. the people are not only friendly but helpful. nobody there and especially the bums do not steal. they enjoy a place nothing more real at venice beach. our rent-a-mustang was safely parked. the sounds day and night are authenitc. the cadillac lets you feel jim morrison without having the stress. what else can you want?

Reviews.Title: “It's time to gut this property and rebuild, seriously.”
Reviews.Author: JJ_Drake
Reviews.Content: Ok, this hotel isn't even up to the level of kitschy fun. It's just a nasty, filthy, broken down eyesore on a tired beach. I stayed in what they called a "prime suite" with a beachfront view. I should have known from the price that this place was a dump, but I'm adventurous, pretty easy-going and try to avoid cookie-cutter chains ... however, even I have my limits. First, the skateboard shop on the lower level plays music so loud you cannot hear on the telephone. Closing the window doesn't help. It starts early in the morning and doesn't wind down until well into the evening, but then the bums are ready for their shift. They sit in a courtyard under the windows and talk all night. Oh, and they get louder as they get more drunk. If you have a nice car or are worried about your rental-car deposit, you don't want to park in the lot. You must park so close to other cars that there's virtually no way to avoid getting dinged. If you get back late at night, there are no spaces left, so the management wants you to leave your keys with them so they can move your car in and out of the center aisle so other cars can get in and out. I wouldn't give my keys to these folks under ANY circumstances, even if my car were a junker. Yes, the hotel is on the beach, but the room windows, which are crowded by the fire-escape stairs, are so small you can't see anything unless you're sitting right next to them. And remember, this was their top "suite." I can't even begin to imagine how horrid the hostel rooms must be. Everything in the room was sticky and grimy. The room stank, and I've seen better furniture dumped near Goodwill bins. The TV was a circa 1970 19" black and white ... I think ... because I could't pick up any stations anyhow. The shower didn't work, which I dealt with, but when I told them at the front desk as I was leaving, they looked at me like, "yeah? so what?" If you want to see Venice and Santa Monica, just pay for a parking space near the beach, they aren't that expensive, or take a cab or public transit, then go back to a better hotel. There are tons of very cool older motels that people are buying and fixing up all around Santa Monica, so if you want to avoid the chains, it's not difficult. But seriously, this place is not fit for the bed bugs that crawl in the night. And that's a real shame, because it could be very cool if it had an owner who gave a hoot.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor...”
Reviews.Author: neecheecat
Reviews.Content: We had booked our room through the website, however when we got to the hotel they had no record of our reservation. luckily we had the confirmation email printed out and they had an available room. however, there is no air conditioning, only one towel was provided and the room had a funny smell. the only positive thing was the location, which is right on the venice beach boardwalk. it was definately like a hostel with hotel prices. i would definately not recommend staying here, i am sure there are far nicer and far cheaper hotels in the area. also, do not go to the italian restaurant across the street if you do decide to stay here, it was horrible! not for the squemish or those wanting to sleep at night!

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: deych00
Reviews.Content: Cadillac Hotel is located directly on the Venice Beach in California. That is it.... Nothing about the hotel is attractive. My wife and I made arrangements to stay in this hotel for 3 nights. I called them directly to find out about the rooms, parking, service, etc. I was totally misinformed. They advertise FREE Parking behind the hotel. Actually, there are only about 15 to 20 spaces and cars are jam packed; and when we arrived around 11 p.m. at night, there was no where to park. The hotel clerk told me it wasn't his problem and that it was first come first serve parking situation. Secondly, the minute I parked by the hotel entrance, 2 people came up to me (they were either drunk or on drugs) telling me they'd call the police if I didn't move my vehicle ASAP. Next, I decided to see the inside of my room. It was nothing like it showed on the picture. The room was about 200 square feet with 3 small beds. The overall appearance of the room was like a homeless shelter. The entrance door didn't have deadlock, just one key. There is no air conditioning in the room. It so happened the day we arrived it was very humid and hot outside, and very stuffy in the room itself. I was also a bit concerned about our safety. In a matter of 10 minutes I saw all kinds of people hanging just outside, and inside the hotel. After 8 hours of overall travel time (flight, car rental, driving distance to hotel) all I wanted was to get into a comfortable hotel and get some rest. Well, not in the Cadillac Hotel... just outside of the hotel there is a cafe and you hear voices, music, and other various noises which is annoying when you're trying to get some rest. Not being able to find a parking spot and considering all the other problems, we left the hotel. Luckily, I was able to find a very nice hotel in downtown Los Angeles (New Otani Garden Hotel) and get accomodations for 3 nights. To sum it all up, Cadillac Hotel is more of a hostel than a hotel and paying $115 per night is a rubbery. I've read the reviews here and was very concerned but when I called the hotel they reassured me that the hotel was nice and that we don't have to worry about anything. Having stayed at many different hotels in the past 10 years or so, let me say that the Cadillac Hotel is by far the worst I've ever seen. Plus, they should be sued for misrepresention.

Reviews.Title: “BEDBUGS !!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: was very dirty, carpet damp which scared me, because it smelled so much of urine. because there was no shower head, the intensity of the water bruised my daughter. bad service, and the worst thing is BEDBUGS!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Special advenure”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i just got back from a great vacation in venice with my boyfriend. just wanted to say thank u for your hospitality,your hotel is placed in the best spot in the heart of venice culture,the staff was very welcoming and helpfull and well known with LA scene.anyway it might not be the fanciest place but very comfortable and accomadating,for its price its the best deal you can get,highly recomended!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Oh God no....”
Reviews.Author: JasonHiggins
Reviews.Content: I cannot believe anyone has rated this above 1 - this is *the* worst hotel I have had the misfortune to stay at in 20 years. Our party of 4 were there for 3 nights and put up with bed bugs (leaving bites that scarred for weeks on the 2 females), poor cleanliness, furniture and curtains that had seen better days by the 1970s, shootings at night (not the hotels fault, admittedly, though I had my fingers crossed that the hotel manager might be involved) and worse, staff who couldn't care less if they tried. We expected it to be a little rough but not this bad. $100 per room per night? Expect a LOT more for your money. You have been warned.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I don't know where to begin. My husband and I got there in the middle of the night having just stayed a week in las vegas. We had booked the best room possible over the internet (the room shown on their website) to stay for a week. As we were shown the room we started to have our doubts and it only got worse!! The floor carpet was greesy, there was no air conditioning in the bedroom and you couldn't open the window, whereas in the bathroom you couldn't shut the window. The whole place was filthy, and there really were bed bugs. The blinds didn't shut and it was noicy outside all night. The shower didn't have a shower head. If marauding gangs and homeless people outside the window are what you are looking for then this is the place for you!!! Both us and several other guests said a little prayer thanking god that our rental cars weren't broken into overnight. The only good thing was that they let us leave the next day without paying for the whole week.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and the Wifey had a great time visiting Venice, CA. Staying at the Cadillac was a terrific choice. The convenience of having whatever your needs may be just minutes away..

Reviews.Title: “funky litttle shack”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a well needed weekend alone together. Had a blast! Stayed up in our room alot of the time just people watching, and there are some pretty strange ones to say the least. Parked the car upon arrival and walked anywhere we needed to go. Great resturant accross the street with really excellent food. Sure the room is a little dumpy and I would not recommend comming here if you are a high maintenance person. If you love people watching and don't need fluffy new towels, than this is the place for you. I'm sure I'll be back, I might even bring my teenagers next time so they can experience it too!

Reviews.Title: “Run For The Marriott!!!! Do Not Stay At Cadillac!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I only listed this place as terrible because I couldn't find a button for "absolutely rediculously nasty". When we got there we get a little tiny room with a view of a cement wall, the bed is about 2 inches thick, the place smelled like urine, this place is so nasty the carpet will stick to your feet. They should charge by the hour. The folks that post on here saying how great the place was are either insane, work for the cadillac, or have never stayed in a decent hotel. We paid for two nights after we complained about the room when we got there they gave us another room with two single beds, we immediately demanded a refund. We drove for 7 hours and just wanted to sleep. Assuring us that the "malibu suite" was the room for us we went upstairs to take a look. It was a dump but inhabitable at this point because we were exhausted, we barely slept that night and woke up bright and early with sore backs on a stained mattress. We asked for a refund on the second night we paid for because we wanted to go find a nicer hotel and we did, right up the road was a marriott. We were given the cell number to the manager of the cadillac "Kerry" to get a refund. This person will never call you back and if you do accidentally get her on the phone she is nicely selling you lies. After a week of leaving messages and emails I finally got Kerry on the phone who assured me the refund money for the night we didn't stay was on it's way to my bank account. She said two days tops it would show up in my account. Well here we are a week later, no refund. The place is a dump!!!!! They leave the windows open because they have no central AC or heat!!!!!!Allowing anyone to crawl into the building!!My back still hurts from the stained mattress I slept on!!!!!! DO NOT STAY AT THE CADILLAC UNLESS YOU ARE COMPLETELY DESPERATE FOR A HOTEL OR HOMELESS!!! Do like we did and RUN FOR THE MARRIOTT!!!!! P.S. Those photos on their website are way outta date, the place looks nothing like their photos and their descriptions are way off. A world class DUMP!!!

Reviews.Title: “strange happenings.........”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I must say, it's hard to decide what to write. Upon arrival to the cadillac they didn't have the right room booked, that was fine since they comped a cot. The room was inexpensive since it was booked online. Dirty-yes, dumpish-yes, friendly-YES! I think it almost outweighs the grossness. If you want to work for a place to stay, don't do it. The bed bugs are horendous in staff rooms (and in some hotel rooms) ask a nice french canadian boy named Martin. I would go again, and I would love it, but I'm a glutton for punishment.

Reviews.Title: “Have fun ”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: keep it real,good deal i really dont know what people are talking about,i just came back from LA with my man and had the best time staying in the cadillac.for its location and the experience i can assure you its the best deal you'll get.its a great place in the heart of venice culture with connection to the scene in anyway. people,when you go on vacation.. try to have some FUN!

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderfull time!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and me spent a lovely week in Cadillac Hotel. Besides the fact the rooms were clean (really clean) the staff was extremely nice and professional. They tried to do their best with every request we had, and it got to a point we couldn't wait to get back to the hotel every day because we felt so comfterble there. We will definitely go back there if we are ever in LA again.

Reviews.Title: “More Hostel than Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Room was clean but that is all. Lacks even the basics of a hotel (ie: towel rack, shower mat, waste backet, hangers, bedspreads or window curtains.) Try to imagine the ugliest room in the ugliest building in the ugliest neighborhood you can imagine, and you will have an idea of the Cadillac Hotel. We felt safe enough in the hotel, but the neighborhood is mostly street people living out of shopping carts. Would have been expensive for half what we paid ($125 including tax) when we stayed on August 1, 2005.

Reviews.Title: “great loctaion, good staff, clean!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: me and my family had a great stay at the cadillac last january. the weather was teriible but our stay in this nice hotel made everything okay again! even though we couldnt see any sunshine out off the window in our beachsuite we enjoyed the view off the wind that was blowing the sand of venice beach over the unfortunately empty boardwalk. we will defenitely stay here again if we will return to venice!

Reviews.Title: “Well, we survived it. . .”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Here's the deal. If you're young, on a budget, looking for lots of nightlife, and don't care about luxuries such as bath mats, hand towels, wash cloths, mattress pads, or any hint of modern amenities, you'll do fine at the Cadillac. We're a couple in our 50s, and we swallowed hard upon checking in and seeing our room. But we toughed it out and really had a wonderful time. Venice Beach took us back to life in the sixties, which was an amusing trip down memory lane. Tons of excellent restaurants nearby, but I'm glad we had a car so that we could escape the hotel as much as possible. Staff was pleasant--even funny--but parking is the stuff of nightmares. We came away with two deep scratches and a couple of interesting dents. We won't go back because we learned that the phrases "right on the beach" and "$100 a night" can never add up to much more than a hostel.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Times”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It was my first trip to LA and wanted to experience the Venice boardwalk. I didnâ€™t have the budget for a 5 star hotel, but didnâ€™t want to stay in a hostel either. I heard of the Cadillac Hotel through a friend and Iâ€™m glad I did. Starting with the basics, the rooms were nice and clean, but the best part was the view. The service was very friendly and the environment is international, the staff and guests come from all over the world. The beach and cool restaurants and cafes were just a stone throw away. So I enjoyed my stay and would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Are you kidding me?”
Reviews.Author: Lover-not-a-Fighter
Reviews.Content: I really don't know what everyone's talking about. My 11 yr old daughter and I have just returned from a 3 week roadtrip through the Southwest and after staying in LA for three nights on the first leg of our trip we carried on to the Grand Canyon. We were to head to New Mexico after that but enjoyed LA so much we decided on a whim to return and stay for as long as we could. We made reservations here (June 1/05) after reading a great review in the Dummies LA book. We arrived after driving in from Death Valley (the hotel front doors are located at the end of a short alley which, granted, leads directly onto the Venice Beach promenade) where we had to put on our hazards so that we could unload all our luggage (hotel parking is back up the alley, take a right onto a one-way street and another right into another alley with say 18-20 parking spots). We were a little wary when we entered the hotel (potentially cool looking area but very dilapidated) but got to the front desk where a nice Oz girl checked us in. She gave us a key (who has these these days?) on which she wrote the room number with black felt. We got up there and let ourselves into a very scary looking room (like an army barracks) with two bunk beds side by side (like two feet away from each other) and NOTHING else, no tv, no side tables, no clock, no nothing and a very scary bathroom with no tub just shower and grotty sink which looked as though was a shared bathroom. I didn't know what to do other than almost cry and sat down with my daughter and my cell and the travel book to try to find something else. We went back downstairs to let them know we didn't think we could stay in that room as for $130 we had reserved a queen bed and figured we'd have something at least SOMEWHAT presentable. She asked which room we were in (I believe it was 308 but not certain) and immediately said oh no, that's not the room I put you in, you were supposed to be in 310 (or whatever it was-I really can't remember). We were iffy about looking at another room after this (as well, if the key for 310 opened 308 then was that a master key? And does anybody else have one as well??-scary thought) but decided we should do it to appease them and so they gave us the key for the new room. We went up and the key didn't work, we tried and tried but no luck. We went back downstairs where they gave us another one we went back up and again didn't work. We were very very frustrated by this time needless to say and went back down where they gave us the ACTUAL master key until they could find the correct key for the room. This finally worked and we entered a fairly nice if clean room with new carpet (chocolate brown) and a bed with a splintery chair by the tv and smallish bathroom with only a shower. THis being the total of all the furniture in the room which had obviously just been renovated as the mirror in the bathroom was hanging crooked and was not covering a mass of open wiring where the vanity lights would have been had there been any. There were no towels in the bathroom, the sink was crooked and there was no hardware (toilet paper holder, etc) at all. The best part of the room was the window which if you looked to the left had a truly fantastic view (if partial and to the left) of the promenade and beach. There was no alarm clock so had to ask for a wakeup call and when I phone to ask for towels I got three mismatched, threadbare grey ones that looked as though they'd be sent over from the haircolouring section of a hairdressers (bleach spots all over and I'm not exagerating). We were to stay for two nights but I phoned the other hotel I had called earlier (Best Western Hollywood Hills) and then cancelled the next night's reservation at the Cadillac. I spoke to the manager the next morning who was very nice and apologetic and we agreed that once all the remodelling has been done the hotel would probably be one to be reckoned with as the location really IS incredible however, I would advise you very, very strongly to call before you stay to ask if the renovations have been completed. A very bad experience.

Reviews.Title: “Super staff and location, but be aware...”
Reviews.Author: LutefiskHater
