Reviews.Content: Very nice staff, we asked for more pillows and towels and they arrived in minutes. We had the California Suite. Outstanding views of ocean and fruitcakes on the beach walk. Hotel was right on the beach. The hotel was funky/dumpy... but this IS Venice after all, eveything is a bit out of wack. Hotel is clean but threadbare. Some exposed wiring in room in service box, hopfully not live (hello fire marshall!). The candle cafe across the street has excellent food at good prices. Parking is a NIGHTMARE at this hotel...but this IS Venice. We would stay again. Highly reccomend you bring a bag of ice and a cheapo styrofoam coolerm for drinks. No fride or coffee maker in room. Hotel has a small gym and dry sauna in basement, but it is kinda creepy down there.

Reviews.Title: “They lost my reservation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I called on 05/30 to make a reservation on 06/03. A female sounding-happily took my reservation with my phone # and creditcard #. She told me it's all set and would see me soon. When we arrived after 5pm, the receptionist told me that they did not have my reservation after searching everythere. So we are just plainly dead on this. Showed my phone record to their number, and they can do nothing. She told us that they did not keep computer record. She referred me to a hotel which has a 5-min driving distance from beach and is priced at $90+tax. No interest to contact any hotel by beach and just told us all full (though it seemed true). It is just impossible to enjoy the beauty of the beach when we walked around to find a hotel then. The gal told us that she would look into it and email me to explain it. No emails on 06/06. Happily find that they haven't made charges on my creditcard, though now I regretted deeply to give it to them. who knows what will happen. So if you plan to stay there, make sure to call them more than once. Better call them one day after your reservation. Call them one day before your arrival too. keep calling to secure.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again....Horrible”
Reviews.Author: ColoMandM
Reviews.Content: Hotel is old and run down. Front desk staff aren't friendly or helpful. Room rate is supposed to include parking in the adjacent lot, but it was full. Front desk clerk was unable to assist me on the parking issue, so I left a message for the manager. He didn't call me back after 24 hours, so I left another message. Again, no call back. I cornered him in the lobby the next day. He claimed he never received my message. When we finally discussed the parking problem, he was rude and refused to reimburse me for the cost of parking in the pay lot down the street. Stay someplace else!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely LOVED it!!!”
Reviews.Author: TCVancouver2005
Reviews.Content: Wow where to begin??? My girlfriend and I checked into the Cadillac Hotel on the 23rd of August 2004 for 5nights, the staff are very friendly and are willing to help if we needed anything, are room had a nice sea view and was clean throughout. There were only small things wrong with the room e.g no shower mat but other than that the room was perfect for the two of us. On the roof is a sun deck which has amazing views of the Beaches and Santa Monica pier. The beach is amazing-you literally step out of the hotel and your there, there is also a cafe across the road called the Blue rose cafe which sold the most delicious breakfasts, and a shop nearby if any drinks where needed for the room. The hotel also arranged tours for us with a discounted price, Disneyland was $134, and Universal studios with a tour of LA in the evening was $140 for the both of us-which is very reasonable because Disneyland is 1hours drive away and the tickets cost $65 each just to get in! At the end of the day you get what you pay for, its not a upmarket hotel but they make you feel very welcome. We left the Cadillac to stay in a more expensive hotel for two nights but both were absolutely brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend this place to your worst enemy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Convinced by their groovy web site I spent a night at this fleabag. The room stank of moldy, mildewy carpeting; the bathroom floor was sticky with god knows what and the place was so dirty that I felt lucky not to have woken up with bedbug bites. Among the guests I saw in the halls or the lobby: Some guy making a phone call with a swastika tattoo on his arm, the ugliest drag queen I've ever seen, and a drunken midget who tried to worm her way upstairs with me. With taxes, the room cost $125 the night, which seems like a lot of money for this circle of Dante's Inferno. I'm thinking of contacting the Better Business Bureau or the LA Chamber of Commerce.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay there - unless you like bedbugs!”
Reviews.Author: LondonRani
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Cadillac in Venice Beach, LA for 1 night last week and were bitten between 30-50 times by small cockroach like insects. The bites swelled and itched for several days. The hotel were totally unapologetic and admitted this had happened regularly. They gave no indication that they would take any action to deal with the situation. We are appalled - the poor hygeine in the hotel clearly led to the insects, and given the normal quality of service in the US, this was way below par. Instead of apologising, the manager just shrugged his shoulders. We have stayed in lots of places which are much more down market in countries which much bigger issues with insects, but nowhere have we had such a bad experience. Our friends who were staying there also had problems - they were looked out of their room for two hours because the lock stopped working. Again - no apology!

Reviews.Title: “I concur: A total dump”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I agree with the other reviewer. a dump. Where were the pictures on the website taken anyway - WARNING - your room may vary. And as far as it being "fully restored art deco landmark" ha ha ha it must have been 'restored' by the same person who did all the strip-malls in the 80s, AND they forgot to restore the bedrooms. Stay elsewhere or look at the actual room before you lay down the plastic.

Reviews.Title: “One night was enough”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel ahead of time and, upon arrival, found the parking to be a nightmare, the lack of a/c unbearable, the noise almost impossible to sleep through, the vagrants outside our door and along the boardwalk hard to ignore and the threat of a fight breaking out at any moment constantly in the forefront of our thoughts. Not good value for the money although the staff were wonderful - they must own the property!!! We promptly left the CAdillac AND Venice Beach the next day. Would not recommend Venice OR the Caddy Hotel to ANYONE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Athenixa
Reviews.Content: My stay in Hotel Cadillac for two days was terrible- it was very noisy and very dirty! At the groundfloor are two shops which are in competition which one has the loudest music - mostly hard rock till late in the night. So I preferred a room at the other side without oceanview, but there was a strange loud sound from the very old aircondition at the roof all night long. The dirt in this hotel was incredible- normally I would have gone at once- but they demanded the full rates in advance and so I could not cancel it. The bathroom was very old and full of black spots also at the shower , the furniture in the room was broken..etc. DonÂ´t waste your money there.

Reviews.Title: “A total sh_t-hole”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: "restored to its original splendor" --- bullsh_t. This place is a total toilet. Don't waste your money. You'd be better off giving your $100 to the street folks and spending the night on the beach.
